description: Change of use from hotel (Use Class C1) to restaurant (Use Class A3) at ground floor level and six self-contained residential units (Use Class C3) at first and second floor levels (4 x 1bed and 2 x 2bed flats) following internal alterations including secure bin storage and bicycle parking
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) 2013/36-01 Rev A, 2013/36-02 Rev A, 2013/36-03 Rev A, 2013/36-04 Rev A and 2013/36-05 Rev A unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, which will achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10.  The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority's criteria.  Reason: To ensure the development complies with Ealing Local Polcy 7A - Amenity of the adopted Development Plan Document 2013 | The rating noise level emitted from the proposed extract duct and any other plant and equipment at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason: To ensure the development complies with Ealing Local Polcy 7A - Amenity of the adopted Development Plan Document 2013 | Before the development is commenced, the ventilation duct from the commercial premises, shall be fixed  to the wall of the dwellings with suitable anti - vibration isolators and the fan motor shall be vibration  isolated from the duct, so as to ensure that an acoustic standard of not greater than LFNR35 Leq,5min  (octaves) or LFNR30 Leq,5min (one third octaves) will be achieved at 1m from the nearest fatade of the  nearest affected premises  Reason: To ensure the development complies with Ealing Local Polcy 7A - Amenity of the adopted Development Plan Document 2013 | The insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the residential dwellings above shall be sufficient to ensure that an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) will be met inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), or NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use.  Reason: To ensure the development complies with Ealing Local Polcy 7A - Amenity of the adopted Development Plan Document 2013 | Deliveries of goods to, and waste collections from the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0800 - 1800 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.  Reason: To ensure the development complies with Ealing Local Polcy 7A - Amenity of the adopted Development Plan Document 2013 | The hours of use of the restaurant (Use Class A3) shall be restricted to the periods of 0900 - 2300.  Reason: To ensure the development complies with Ealing Local Polcy 7A - Amenity of the adopted Development Plan Document 2013 | The applicant shall submit to the local planning authority for approval prior to the commencement of development a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms on the Steyne Road, Acton, facade. The supply to be provided from the rear of the building at high level. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied  Reason: To ensure the development complies with Ealing Local Polcy 7A - Amenity of the adopted Development Plan Document 2013 | An Ultra - Low NOx boiler with maximum NOx Emissions of under 0.040 g/kWh shall be installed in each    residential dwelling. The works, as approved, shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter  permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure the development complies with Ealing Local Polcy 7A - Amenity of the adopted Development Plan Document 2013 | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority, before the development is commenced, for the installation, operation, and maintenance of the best practicable cooking extract system, including the provision of a suitable extract fan, odour control equipment, with a vertical discharge terminus without any cap or cover, at a minimum of 1.5 metres above the highest roof eaves of the building.  The details shall satisfy the advice at "DEFRA, 2005:Guidance on the Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems".  The system, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.  Reason: To ensure the development complies with Ealing Local Polcy 7A - Amenity of the adopted Development Plan Document 2013 | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority (legal agreement) and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that the development is car-free and does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone in accordance with policy 6.13 of the adopted Ealing Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 6.13 of the London Plan 2011. | Refuse storage shall be provided in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the commencement of the development and retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2011) policy 5.16. | A minimum of eight (8) cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site in accordance with drawing number 2013/36-02 Rev A prior to first occupation and retained permanently.  Reason:            To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Core Strategy and policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011
